titleStmt.title: R. F. Vinson to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7851

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Louisa Ky Sep 16th 1862.
To the Secretary State Ky.

Dear Sir -- The Election Returns for Lawrence County were duly placed in the Post Office in this place but up to this date the Commissions of the Presiding Judge and Justices Elected have not come to hand I here give a list of those Elected.
Pleasant M Savage was duly Elected Presing Judge
John Savage " " " J. P. for Dis No 1.
John Thompson " " " J. P. for Dis " 4
Berry E Fuggitt " " " J. P. " Dis " 5.
Michael Wellman " " " J. P. " Dis " 6.
John Jones. " " " J P. " Dis. " 9.

It is important at least that the Presidng Judge should be commissioned and Great issue, as the old Co Judge is absent and no Justice of the Pease living nearer than 5 miles of the Courthouse if the Election Return for the other officers have not reached you let me know and I will forward them again

Respectfully
R. F. Vinson Co C. Clk.
per Geo B Pough Dpy

Lawrence Co
Duplicate Comms
Issd to Co Judge & J P.
Jany 57. 1863
